definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: The clear orchid continues to lower the head, heart course, you drag down, menace who?
sentences.chinese: 明蘭繼續低着頭，心道，您拉倒吧，唬誰呢？

sentences.english: I could have bluffed that fellow down.
sentences.chinese: 我本可以繼續下注唬倒那個傢伙。

definition: to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
lit. dress up as God, play the devil (idiom); fig. to mystify/to deceive people/to scam
to be angry about sth but also find it laughable
lit. show strength while weak inside (idiom); appearing fierce while cowardly at heart/a sheep in wolf's clothing
variant of 愣[leng4]/to look distracted/to stare blankly/distracted/blank
variant of 稜|棱, corner/square beam/edge/arris (curve formed by two surfaces meeting at an edge)/see 楞迦 Sri Lanka
to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
to open one's eyes wide/to stare/to glare (at sb)/to scowl
